Relocated from Keystone, CO. Yan Chairs with Doppelmayr Grip, hanger, and bail. Some Doppelmayr towers.

This lift was originally called Northeast Passage and was 9243 feet long with 1436 vertical, the longest triple chair in the world. The bottom terminal was moved uphill in the mid 1990s.

Retrofitted with a Yan drive terminal and CTEC bails and hangars
Relocated from Killington Peak, retrofitted with a Yan drive terminal and chairs.
Made from a mix of new Poma parts and old Yan and Poma parts. Has Poma towers, chairs, drive terminal and Yan return terminal, grips, and hangars
This lift runs in a triangle, with the uphill side turning about halfway. The downhill section is only 4128 feet long. Towers 12 and 13 have entire bullwheels mounted on them.

Relocated from Lake Louise, AB. Riblet chairs and clips
